newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rexrodt - Germany's chance to meet EMU targets good.
newsitem.headline: Rexrodt - Germany's chance to meet EMU targets good.

text.p: Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt said Germany would do everything it can to meet the fiscal criteria for entry into European economic and monetary union (EMU) in 1999.

"The chances are good that we will do this," Rexrodt said in an interview with the daily Magdeburger Volkstimme newspaper. "I still presume that we will meet the criteria and enter European monetary union on time."
The Maastricht treaty on economic and monetary union states that participants must meet a range of fiscal targets, the toughest of which have been restrictions on budget deficits and public debt.
Many economists have expressed doubts that Germany will meet the targets this year, the crunch year that will be the basis on which EMU participants are chosen early in 1998.
